page.title: 01MANACCAN AREA _ SUMMARY
page.content: This area consists of the village of Manaccan-mainly older cottages with a church,village hall,shops,garage etc.,with St.Anthony in Meneage(Monks Land) situated down by the creekside and Helford Village. There is a very pretty church, boatyard, homes and holiday cottages nestling in the trees. There are several houses at Gillan and Flushing, some fairly modern, with their own local shop. There are woods, Carne Creek and the Durra River which once supported five mills but sadly none are now working. It is mainly an agricultural area with several retirement homes. There is an abundance of wildlife and birds which make it a very attractive place in which to live.
